contact_information.personal_website: no personal email added, placeholder for future update

professional_summary: Beginning - : I started my rabbit hole of technology around the time I was 8-9 years old.
My curiosity was piqued by the various gadgets and gizmos that surrounded me.
Youth - : I got my first personal device, an iPod Touch Gen2 for Christmas around that time.
Having ADHD and a mind for wanting to see how things work
I took a look into the settings and found all sorts of different options.
This sparked my interest in understanding the underlying technology.
Teenage_Years - : During my teenage years, I delved deeper into the world of technology.
I began experimenting with basic programming and built my first simple websites.
My passion for tech grew as I explored different programming languages and tools.
I spent countless hours coding, dismantling old electronics, and reading tech blogs to stay updated on the latest trends.
High_School - : In high school, I joined the computer club and participated in various tech competitions.
I also took advanced courses in computer science, which provided me with a solid foundation in coding and problem-solving.
My involvement in extracurricular activities, such as hackathons and coding boot camps, further solidified my interest and skills in technology.
College - : I pursued a degree in Computer Science, where I honed my skills in software development, data structures, algorithms, and system design.
I completed several internships that provided hands-on experience in real-world projects.
My college years were marked by extensive project work, collaborative learning, and continuous exploration of emerging technologies.
Recently - : Taking all this into account, I had to know more.
I'm 22 years old and have been learning the basics of everything in today's tech-consumed world so I can be prepared for more.
Recently, I have focused on developing my skills in AI, cloud computing, and cybersecurity.
My recent projects include developing AI models, setting up cloud infrastructures, and implementing security protocols.
Current_Focus - : Currently, I am working on enhancing my expertise in artificial intelligence and machine learning.
I am also actively involved in open-source projects and enjoy collaborating with other tech enthusiasts to create innovative solutions.
My current work involves building machine learning models, contributing to open-source repositories, and mentoring budding developers.
Future_Aspirations - : Looking ahead, I aim to leverage my diverse tech background to drive impactful projects that solve real-world problems.
My goal is to continuously learn and adapt to the ever-evolving tech landscape, ensuring that I remain at the forefront of technological advancements.
I aspire to lead groundbreaking projects, contribute to the tech community, and inspire others to pursue their passion in technology.

specializations: I specialize in code/web surfing and debugging.
I write scripts to analyze data visually in an appealing, information-conveying way.
This includes but isn't limited to: colors, numbers, text, fonts, graphs, and pie charts.

experience.description: Worked under the Head Network Administrator Mr. Black. Repaired student laptops and rewired the facility.
Built Nissan Titans and Frontiers on the production line.
skills: Learned TIG welding, processed inventory assets, and managed supply replacement of parts and wearables.

experience.description: Performed oil changes, brake fluid services, and learned critical information about vehicles.
Performed oil changes, tire rotations, and managed cars in the lot and shop.
Worked inventory management, kept the shop clean and up to date on supplies and assisted technicians.

achievements.title: First in District's Congressional App Challenge
achievements.description: Application was displayed in Washington D.C. at the Capital Building for a year.

personal_projects.project_title: Intro to Mechanical Engineering Course Project
description: Created a scale model of the school grounds from scratch.
Modeled buildings in Blender at a 350:1 scale.
Display includes working lights and a rising flag.
I love to drive. Backroads or from a dig, you name it.
Convoys to the beach with friends is one of my favorite things to do.
